cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles NW of San Juan Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest, passing north of Hispaniola and the Turks & Caicos, then toward the Bahamas and ultimately south Florida/Florida Keys late this weekend

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cuba from Matanzas province eastward to Guantanamo and the north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico (including Vieques & Culebra), northern Dominican Republic coast, northern Haiti coast, Turks & Caicos, southeastern and central Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands through Puerto Rico, Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, Cuba and the southeast U.S. coastline
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (gusts well over 100 mph) affected the port; tropical-storm-force winds extend 185 mi from the center
weather_observation.storm_surge: Northern coast surge 2–4 ft (locally above 3 ft) with large breaking waves
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches (isolated 20 in) likely, producing flash flooding and mudslides
weather_observation.other_hazards: Life-threatening surf and rip currents; possible debris and infrastructure damage disrupting port operations
